commit_analysis.message:
Implement comprehensive Bitcoin development platform with MinimalDock integration

🚀 Core Features Added:
• TokenDashboard: Real-time developer analytics and performance tracking
• ContractWizard: 6-step developer contract creation with blockchain integration
• MinimalDock: Collapsible dock with seamless toggle functionality
• DeveloperContractService: Smart contract management with BSV timestamping
• TokenAllocationManager: 500M $BCODE token pool with performance multipliers
• GitBlockchainService: Git operations with automatic blockchain verification

💎 Token System:
• Strategic allocation: 50% of 1B $BCODE tokens for developers
• Performance-based multipliers (0.5x to 3x)
• Vesting schedules for large allocations (>15M tokens)
• Quality assessment and automated rewards

🔗 Blockchain Integration:
• BSV timestamping for all contracts and commits
• Hash verification and data integrity
• Mock implementations with production-ready interfaces
• Revenue sharing architecture

🎨 UI/UX Enhancements:
• Dual dock system (full/minimal) with localStorage persistence
• Rainbow-colored Bitcoin app icons with smooth animations
• Mobile-responsive design with optimized touch targets
• Real-time status indicators and system integration

🛠️ Technical Improvements:
• Event-driven architecture for dock state management
• Service-oriented design with singleton patterns
• Comprehensive error handling and validation
• ESLint warnings resolved, production build ready

🧪 Testing & Build:
• Successful production build with 154.28 kB main bundle
• All TypeScript errors resolved
• Mobile-optimized responsive layouts
• Cross-browser compatibility ensured

🔧 Development Tools:
• Added npm scripts for port management
• Enhanced build pipeline with react-app-rewired
• Git integration preparation for blockchain timestamping

🌈 Bitcoin Ecosystem:
• Complete Bitcoin OS integration
• 24 Bitcoin apps with rainbow theming
• Corporate branding and trust indicators
• Community links and partnership integrations

🎯 Next Phase Ready:
• Revenue Sharing Dashboard foundation
• App Deployment Pipeline to bitcoinapps.store
• Full Git blockchain integration architecture

commit_analysis.author: Junio C Hamano

commit_analysis.message:
Merge branch 'ps/ci-avoid-broken-sudo-on-ubuntu'

Our CI script requires "sudo" that can be told to preserve
environment, but Ubuntu replaced with "sudo" with an implementation
that lacks the feature.  Work this around by reinstalling the
original version.

* ps/ci-avoid-broken-sudo-on-ubuntu:
  ci: fix broken jobs on Ubuntu 25.10 caused by switch to sudo-rs(1)
commit_analysis.author: Junio C Hamano

commit_analysis.message:
ci: fix broken jobs on Ubuntu 25.10 caused by switch to sudo-rs(1)

Ubuntu 25.10 has been released. One prominent change in this version of
Ubuntu is the switch to some Rust-based utilities. Part of this switch
is also that Ubuntu now defaults to sudo-rs(1).

Unfortunately, this breaks our CI because sudo-rs(1) does not support
the `--preserve-env` flag. Let's revert back to the C-based sudo(1)
implementation to fix this.

Signed-off-by: Patrick Steinhardt <ps@pks.im>
Signed-off-by: Junio C Hamano <gitster@pobox.com>
commit_analysis.author: Patrick Steinhardt
